antichess
Interface TextGamePlayer

All Superinterfaces:
GamePlayer<ChessMove>
All Known Implementing Classes:
TextAIPlayer, TextPlayer
public interface TextGamePlayer
extends GamePlayer<ChessMove>

The TextGamePlayer interface supports methods that the TextUI will call in order to fit the specifications for the TextUI. TextGamePlayer method TextUI Command ------------------------------------------ doMove | MakeMove getPossibleMove | GetNextMove doPossibleMove | MakeNextMove ------------------------------------------

Specification Fields
  • controller //GameController the controller requesting a move
  • currentMove //ChessMove that the controller can request with getMove
  • possibleMove //ChessMove that is cached. the controller has no access to this.

Method Summary
 boolean doMove(String moveString, long time)
          Asks the TextGamePlayer to do a move described by moveString that takes time milliseconds.
 boolean doPossibleMove()
          Asks the TextGamePlayer to do the move returned by getPossibleMove If not move is returned by getPossibleMove no move is performed
 void getPossibleMove()
          Asks the TextGamePlayer to set a possible move if it can.
 
Methods inherited from interface antichess.GamePlayer
automaticallyTimed, gameEnded, getMove, getPlayerType
 

Method Detail

doMove

boolean doMove(String moveString,
               long time)
Asks the TextGamePlayer to do a move described by moveString that takes time milliseconds. If this TextGamePlayer is a 'human' player ie TextPlayer then it will set currentMove to the move described by move string, if the move is illegal it will output "Illegal move".

Returns:
true iff the move is legal
Effects:
if is TextPlayer currentMove = the move represented by moveString if is TextAIPlayer no effects
Modifies:
currentMove

getPossibleMove

void getPossibleMove()
Asks the TextGamePlayer to set a possible move if it can. A TextPlayer is unable to set a move A TextAIPlayer is able to

doPossibleMove

boolean doPossibleMove()
Asks the TextGamePlayer to do the move returned by getPossibleMove If not move is returned by getPossibleMove no move is performed
